newsitem.title: ITALY: Italy approves third mobile phone licence decree.
newsitem.headline: Italy approves third mobile phone licence decree.

text.p: The Senate or upper house of the Italian parliament approved a decree on Thursday which will open the way for a tender for the country's third mobile phone licence, meaning the bill now becomes law.
Sources at the Senate said the decree, which has already been approved by the lower house, had passed without any modification to the text.
The third licence is to be for a manager of a PCN standard mobile phone service.

Italy already has two GSM mobile phone service operators, state-controlled Telecom Italia Mobile (TIM) and Omnitel, which is controlled by an international consortium led by information technology group Olivetti.

Several companies have expressed interest in the third licence, including a consortium consisting of Albacom, a joint venture between British Telecom, Banca Nazionale del Lavoro and Italian private broadcaster Mediaset.
A joint venture consisting of Italian electricity utilitity Enel and Deutsche Telekom is also interested.
The government has said the tender will open towards the middle of July and the licence will be awarded between the end of November and middle of December.
